direction.raw_text: to reveal that the dark gray gulch filled the screen was in fact two paving stones on a Parisian street and the yellowish river that ran down the middle of the stones comes in two tiny streams that lead to two little boys, who are peeing on the pavement, laughing at their mischief. The boys are twins. They wear backpacks and are set to go off to school. Just then we HEAR the voice of a WOMAN shouting in French (with English subtitles).
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) What do you think you're going?! You ought to be ashamed behaving like that!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: to reveal ever more scenes of life on this particular street. The woman shouts at the children from her window and the children run off. At the corner, fresh bread is being delivered to a sidewalk cafe, as chairs are set out at tables by white aproned waiters who are preparing for their morning clientele.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to reveal a taxi driver arguing with a deliver man as a husband kisses his wife goodbye and set off for work as we continue pulling back and across the city over Montmartre, picking up an argument between two drivers here, fresh bread being delivered to a cafe over there. Chairs are being set up at sidewalk tables as the city awakens and we float across Montmartre into a small residential quarter. Husbands kiss wives who send school children on their way as TITLES CONTINUE and the city comes more and more to life and we hover across a small square just up from the Place de la Opera, not far from the Boulevard Saint Germain-des-Pres, with Montmartre in the b.g. The square has a sidewalk cafe with tables extending out onto a peninsula of pavement that stretches to the foot of a small hotel, whose shuttered windows overlook the square. As we pull back and back over the small square, we literally...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Pull backwards through the slats of the shutter, going from an aerial shot, being sucked in through the semi-closed shutters into a hotel room where we continue ever so slowly, pulling back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The first thing we SEE in this shot which should appear seamless in its one continuous motion transition from the preceding scene, is a spider-web. We are TIGHT on the web in which a still-living insect struggles against his silky bonds. The web begins to tremble as from up above the spider drops, spinning thread lowering itself down on this latest victim, soon to be lunch. As the spider makes this journey we become aware in the b.g. of the panting sounds of lovemaking. It is a woman's breathless sighs and gasps we hear, but under that, perhaps a man's voice, perhaps not. The sounds build to a climax as the camera continues to pull back until it discovers the glistening body of a beautiful young Parisian woman in post-coital dewy Nirvana. Then, the figure of a nude man in silhouette enters frame and crosses over to the shuttered window. His face and body are half-lit by the slats of light that penetrate from the world outside the hotel room. He lights a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON - CLOSE ON THE MAN whom we will come to know as CARLOS. He lights the cigarette and takes a thirsty drag sucking the smoke deep into his lungs, glancing out at the street and alternately at the spider who tiptoes down to her prey. He watches the spider envelop the still-living victim with her spindly legs. Then he takes another drag on the cigarette and the ash glows bright, a burning ember which he touches ever so slowly to the spider's body. It sizzles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks out through the shutters at the digital clock across the square. Then he glances back at the girl whom we will call COLETTE. The conversation is in French with English subtitles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carlos crosses to her slowly. He runs his hand across her cheek, then down across her throat. Death is in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (whispering to the burnt spider) You lose...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I mean get out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're a pig, you know that? How can you be like that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (barely above a whisper) Leave without saying another word.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Carlos stands in front of the mirror. The mirror is cracked and in it we see the fractured face of Carlos staring back at us from opposite sides of the cracked glass. He wears surgical gloves. From a make up kit by the side of the sink he removes a piece of false hair and spirit gum as TITLES CONTINUE. A. Carlos affixes a John Lennon mustache. B. Carlos puts on a brown wig of moderately longish hair such as one might have seen on a student in Paris in the early seventies. C. Carlos puts on a pair of John Lennon granny glasses and the student look is complete. D. Carlos stands in front of a full length mirror in jeans and a blue work shirt over which he puts a worn grey jacket. He now looks every inch the young French student dressing down to look like one of the proletariat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Carlos takes an M26 hand grenade and puts it into an inside pocket of his coat. He puts a machine pistol and snaps its ammo clip into it and puts it in his student's shoulder bag and then takes a Walther PPK and places it in his jeans at the small of his back. All the while that he is doing these things he sings: "ALL YOU NEED IS LOVE."
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (singing) All you need is love... Rum da, da da da All you need is love Rum da da da da All you need is lo-ve Love is all you need. Love is all you need.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : Paris, September 15, 1974.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a hot Sunday afternoon and the complex of shops and a cafe in St. Germain-des-Pres is bustling with young clientele. Inside the cafe, there is a second floor with a balustrade overlooking the tables inside. Outside, there are tables set up on the sidewalk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a tall, husky American in his late thirties, sits at one of the front tables outside. He reads the International Herald Tribune. The headline is, "Terrorists Seize Embassy, Issue Demands And Threaten Attacks." Jack sips his espresso.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: dressed as in preceding scene. He enters. Just then Jack looks up and sees him. For an instant, Carlos looks at Jack, tenses just slightly. Jack looks back at his paper paying no attention. Carlos pulls out a cigarette, pats his pockets for a light. Then he crosses to Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He mimes flicking a match and Jack looks for a match. He's out. He offers the lit end of his cigarette. Carlos cups Jack's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He crosses away from Jack, smiling and goes inside the cafe. Jack follows him absentmindedly, tracking his progress through the windows, though his view is obscured somewhat by reflections of the street. Carlos steps casually to the railing overlooking the tables inside as Jack sees the double image of Carlos and the reflected street scene. Carlos leans over, pulls the pin from an M26 grenade, and lets the "spoon" come off in his hand. We HEAR the timing fuse hiss as Carlos nonchalantly counts to himself.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Pardon monsieur...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Merci.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (counting) One thousand one... one thousand two... one thousand three...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ON - JACK He looks up just in time to see Carlos drop the grenade casually into the crowd below. Their eyes lock for a beat; then Carlos smiles, turns and bounds away. Jack's eyes widen in horror. He gets up, about to cry out a warning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON the crowd below as the grenade EXPLODES, filling the air with smoke and flying glass, its metal ripping through flesh and bone. People are wounded, bloody and writhing in pain and screaming in panic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: disheveled, covered with the shattered glass of the window, but not but not seriously hurt, he struggles to his feet. He looks around for Carlos who has vanished, now realizing who he was. As he looks around, he sees a SMALL BOY staring at his left arm with heart-rending disbelief. The boy has no hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are throngs of ambulances, police and military personnel, wounded survivors are being tended to. All is confusion and off in a corner we SEE Jack, standing with a man in a suit. The man's name is DU FOLTIERE. He shows Jack an I.D.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Du Foltiere pulls out a small notebook to take notes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Du Foltiere, Monsieur, intelligence liaison officer. DST. My understanding is that you are the Deputy Chief of Station, CIA, Paris, and that you witnessed by coincidence this attack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you have told my subordinate that you recognized the terrorist as Carlos?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's not what I told him. I said he recognized me. Afterwards I realized who he was. By then it was too late.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (writing in his notebook) Ah yes... The deputy chief of station did not recognize him... But he recognized you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wasn't the one wearing the disguise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes of course... But then how are you sure it was him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How often do you see someone holding a live grenade listening to the fuse? Besides, the arrogant son of a bitch bastard smiled at me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . OPEC HQ - DAY SUPERIMPOSED: Vienna, December 21, 1975 It's a cold Sunday morning with a light snow just beginning to fall when SIX YOUNG MEN and ONE WOMAN enter the headquarters of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries -- a modern, seven-story block of concrete and glass. They all carry Adidas sport bags over their shoulders. Their leader, Carlos, with dark beret and sunglasses, sports a long white raincoat -- the kind that was very much in fashion that winter. Next to him is KOJ, a Japanese terrorist and his most trusted Lieutenant.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (singing) I shot the sheriff... But I did not shoot the deputy...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: At a long oval table TWELVE OIL MINISTERS. Miniature national flags in chromium holders in front of them. Behind, sitting or standing, the SECRETARIES, ADVISERS, INTERPRETERS AND BODYGUARDS.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...Obviously some of the members are exploiting the oil price differentials as a loophole... This body has been very precise in its policy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The group with the Adidas sport bags approaches the reception desk. Carlos -- moustache, sideburns, and wispy beard in reddish brown -- smiles politely at the female RECEPTIONIST. Behind the reception desk are two circular staircases which wind their way up to an elevator that is visible behind the railing at the top of the landing. There is what appears to be a security man standing at that elevator with an earpiece and tell-tale bulge under his jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smiling back, the ash-blonde receptionist nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As if on urgent business, Carlos quickly heads up the flight of stairs before the security man who stands next to the receptionist can react. The security man speaks quickly into his walkie talkie.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in German) Pardon me. Is the conference still in progress?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in German) Yes, but sir...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in German) I have an urdent delivery for the ministers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ON - THE LANDING by the elevator at the top of the stairs. Carlos bounds up the stairs and pushes the elevator button. The Security Man near the elevator listens intently to what is being said in his earpiece and he steps forward to challenge Carlos. Carlos smiles at him and whips out a 9mm. silenced Beretta and fires two shots right between the Security Man's eyes. He falls over the railing and lands face up on the console in front of the terrified receptionist. Carlos leans over the rail in one move and fires two shots into the upturned face of the Security Man who stands next to the shocked receptionist. The receptionist screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (angry) I protest the unfound charges of the oil minister from Venezuela. We do not use, nor intend to use, the lower gradings to capture more of the market -- His words are cut short when the door is kicked open, and Carlos strides in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone frantically hits the floor. That is, with the exception of TWO BODYGUARDS. They try for their weapons. A short burst from Carlos' Beretta machine pistol which is pulled from the inside of his trenchcoat brings them to the floor. This weapon is not silenced, but deafening. Just then Koj enters the room from the corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, there's the sound of INTENSE GUNFIRE coming from the corridor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (brandishing his automatic)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've got company.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ON - CARLOS He reaches into his trenchcoat and pulls out a pocket-sized Chinese RGD5 grenade. He yanks the pin, lets the spoon fly, listens to the fuse hiss, counts quite calmly and then tosses the live grenade to Koj who catches it and in one movement tosses it out the door. A loud sound of GRENADE EXPLOSION, and plaster powders those glued to the floor. GASPS OF TERROR. But the gunfire outside ceases.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His smile is cunning, mocking, and... familiar.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My name is Carlos. You'll do as I say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We SEE an Air France jet liner touch down on the runway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack comes down the steps of the just-landed jet. The blizzard whips around his face as he walks down the stair unit and onto the tarmac, pulling his overcoat up around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MAGIC HOUR - EST.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind the desk is CARL MICKENS, the CIA Station Chief -- tall, angular, cropped grey hair. He is in mid-conversation with Jack Shaw who sits opposite him, his overcoat over the arm of the chair in which he sits. He has obviously just come from the airport.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mickens looks at him almost in horror. Jack knows he has let down too much of the mask of professionalism as it were.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...Twenty million dollars ransom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's asking for it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "The Arm of the Arab Revolution." Alias of the month time. (shrugs) Could be anybody. The point is... their leader claims to be Carlos...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He does, does he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He wants to make sure everyone knows it's him. He wants the credit and the Austrians want a positive ID. That's when your name came up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who brought my name up?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The guy who says he's Carlos. The Austrians want you there to identify him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At the airport. Tomorrow. When they provide the plane to fly him and the hostages to Libya. Carlos evidently feels very comfortable in Libya.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They got him here in their own backyard and they're gonna let him walk away?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They've got no choice, Jack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bullshit! Let 'em handle it like the Israelis would.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're not the Israelis Jack. It's not their fight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then let me take him out! They want me to meet him at the airport. I can get close enough to get a clear shot at him. We can end this shit now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jack! He's got seventy hostages.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fuck the hostages!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (apologetically) Harold, we can handle it with a minimum loss of life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We will handle it with no loss of life. Those aren't just any hostages. They are the oil ministers of the richest countries in the world, and that twenty million bucks they're gonna have to pay isn't gonna break 'em you know. It's nothing to them. They just want to pay it and... it's not our fight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you think Carlos is gonna do with that money? Put it in mutual funds? He'll use it to hit us. Let me assemble a team and we can...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jack goddamnit, there isn't any team to assemble! You're a fuckin' dinosaur. We're out of the assassination business. All of us! You got a personal hard on against this guy because he made you look like an asshole and now he's gonna rub your nose in it. I can appreciate your feelings, but it's not going down on our soil. It is not with our nationals and it is not our fight! Now I got my orders and you just got yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Carl, Jack and various other CIA functionaries walk quickly down the corridor with Austrian police and intelligence officers. Jack carries a briefcase as do they all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON - JACK JACK I gotta hit the john.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack stands inside of a stall in the men's room. He has just crossed a certain frontier in his mind and stepped in to the area known as no man's land. He quickly takes off his overcoat and jacket and we SEE attached to his arm a harness made up of straps and springs. He opens his briefcase and attaches to the harness a .32 caliber Beretta. He fumbles with the adjustments, racing against time. Finally, he seems to have adjusted everything just so. Then he lowers his arm to his side. Then he raises the right arm as if shaking hands and the harness slams the .32 caliber Beretta from his forearm straight into his palm. He resets the gun back into the forearm position. He has a look of grim determination on his face. The only question is, is it the look of someone who is crazy enough to do what he is contemplating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the tarmac, an Austrian Airways DC9. TV cameras, lights, generators are set up in front of the plane, sending beams and pools of yellow light into the darkness and the snow which swirls all around as a pool of REPORTERS stands ready to record whatever is about to go down. Among a small group of OFFICIALS is Jack Shaw. Everyone's eyes are on an approaching yellow curtained bus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As it gets closer, we can detect through its windshield a white raincoat and a black beret. Carlos is standing by the driver with a machine-pistol in one hand and a grenade in the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His eyes strain to get a better look at the terrorist, his arm down at his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the bus parks by the DC 9, Carlos jumps out and waves to the media. Not the customary V-sign, but the wave of a celebrity... The hostages then, under their captors' guns, file compliantly out of the bus and onto the plane. A line of exhausted, bleary-eyed middle-aged men in expensive suits and in need of a shave. Carlos however, is as fresh, alert and energetic as the morning of the attack. And he's definitely savoring the moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tense, he tries to be inconspicuous as he leans towards Mickens.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (whispering) I think it's him, but I can't be sure. Not with those dark glasses and the beard...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Everyone on board, he too climbs the mobile steps and disappears into the plane. Suddenly, he reemerges and comes down to where the officials and Jack stand. As Jack watches him intently, he faces the MINISTER OF THE INTERIOR. In the window of the plane we SEE Koj holding a grenade to the pilot's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Minister of the Interior, I presume...? The distinguished-looking man, who looks a bit like Kurt Waldheim, nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His eye catching Jack, he stops in mid-sentence. A devilish smile crosses his lips as he turns towards him. He pulls a cigarette out and crosses right over to Jack, up close and as they say, very personal. The snowflakes whirl surrealistically around them as the two stand face to face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He mimes flicking a match. He takes off his glasses and looks at Jack and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a cunning, mocking smile he extends his hand out to shake Jack's. Jack stares at him, ever so slowly beginning to raise his hand. With that move he knows the gun will come slapping into his palm and he will be able to take Carlos out no matter what the cost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His hand starts rising. In another second the gun will spring into it. Just then we hear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack turns to look at Mickens. Mickens indicates the photographers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack is momentarily confused. He has turned to Mickens thinking perhaps he was calling out a warning and now the moment for the shot has passed. He turns back to Carlos who shrugs and steps over to the Austrian minister so that the Minister now is between Jack and Carlos and the shot is lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once again he sticks out his hand. Only this time, as the cameras roll, Austria's Minister of the Interior shakes the hand of the archterrorist in what will go down in history as the "handshake of shame."
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry this had to happen in Austria. We have no quarrel with your government.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pardon monsieur...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We were never really properly introduced Mister Shaw. My name is Carlos.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) Eat shit and die slow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Jack, no!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't want your picture taken shaking his hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the minister) As I was saying, I'm sorry about the loss of life. And thank you for your cooperation.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: His eyes tell it all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We begin with an ESTABLISHING SHOT of Al Aksa Mosque and the Mosque of Omar in Jerusalem. These are the two most famous landmarks in Jerusalem's Old City skyline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CAMERA then pans and tilts down and we are above the Western Wall looking down on the bobbing black hats of Hassidic Jews, the knitted skullcaps of more modern Orthodox, here and there the olive shirt of Army uniform with M16 or Galil assault rifle that sways in prayer as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : To the Jerusalem stone paving stones that make up the square in front of the wall as we glide across the intersecting lines of paving stones set one next to the other until a glowing cigarette comes into view and then a foot which crushes it out. There should be something in this sequence that is reminiscent of our opening, a foreboding that just as the cracks in the Parisian paving stones led us to Carlos once before, perhaps these new stones will lead us once again to some act of terror.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: - AUGUST
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: to reveal a man standing in silhouette, the man who has just crushed out the cigarette. We cannot see his face because he has a camera to his eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the lens of the camera just established we SEE an old Rabbi praying at the wall. CLICK! The shutter captures the shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man in silhouette now lowers the camera and we SEE that he is CARLOS! There is no mistake even though the nose, perhaps is a little different and this time he is clean- shaven, it is still Carlos the Jackals. He smiles slightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Busy photographing it, Carlos doesn't seem to notice the TWO ARABS who watch him surreptitiously. He walks in front of soldiers who laugh and look at us POV Carlos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carlos reaches into his pocket. Is he perhaps going for a grenade to toss at these soldiers? We build tension as he pulls out instead, another roll of film and with great determination, we have the CLICK of the door of the camera to enhance our music beat as tension builds. Surely it can't be long till Carlos does something awful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MOSLEM QUARTER - DAY Carlos walks towards the Suq, working his way through the crown from the Damascus gate as we reveal more soldiers in the foreground, surveilling the area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MOSLEM QUARTER - DAY From the POV of the two Arabs following him, we SEE Carlos lost, or pretending to be, as he ambles along through the Suq, past all sorts of vendors hawking their wares. Heads of fish are cut off with the swift slash of a knife in one stall, freshly skinned lambs hang by their feet in another. Carlos, still looking lost, approaches a street vendor hawking rosary beads. We SEE them talk but cannot hear their dialogue. Carlos walks on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MOSLEM QUARTER - DAY A group of children play an impromptu game of soccer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - POV CARLOS THROUGH CAMERA LENS We watch these innocent children playing. If this was a gun sight they'd be dead. CLICK!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is Carlos who has taken the picture. His smile at the sight of the children is no longer a subtle one. There is some secret enjoyment here. It's then, that he notices the Two Arabs tailing him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON - CARLOS He frowns. Now what happens can be interpreted in one of two ways. Carlos takes a turn down an alleyway that has at first a shop or two, and then is nothing but deserted and foreboding alley. He is either trying to shake the two Arabs or he has just entered every tourist's nightmare: a deserted alley in a foreign country with two bad guys. He quickens his pace. The Arabs do too. Carlos now knows they're after him and he takes off running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MOSLEM QUARTER - DAY - CHASE SEQUENCE ANGLE So do the two Arabs. Only now there are THREE MORE ARABS coming after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A tense, desperate CHASE in the Moslem Quarter's labyrinth of twisted alleys and narrow streets. When his Arab pursuers lose sight of him briefly, Carlos takes something out of his pocket, some sort of ID and throws it in an alleyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carlos races through the Suq, past a group of Arabs who begin heeding the call to prayer. They roll out prayer mats and begin acclaiming in Arabic that there is only one God and Mohammed is his prophet. Carlos grabs one of the canvas awnings that shade the alleyways and this cafe. He rips it off, trying to make an obstacle course between him and his pursuers. He overturns trays of olives, sacks of sunflower seeds, anything he can get his hands on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carlos runs headlong into a copper serving platter that is hanging on display. He is disoriented, terrified, and then seemingly from out of nowhere, he is tackled, grabbed by the Arabs and dragged to a dark alley between two stores. Carlos is overcome and brought down to the ground. One of the Arabs evidently has a deep dislike for Carlos and though Carlos is subdued, he kicks the shit out of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This room is your worst nightmare in the Middle East. It could be a cellar suite in Beirut, or an interrogation cell in Damascus. There is no way of knowing. It is simply an empty room with a large metal ring embedded into the floor, to which Carlos is shackled. Battered and badly bruised, he's obviously in great pain. The room's metal door SCREECHES as it opens slowly and a new man whom we will call AMOS enters. With him are two of the Arabs we've seen earlier. They're bareheaded now, without their kaffiyehs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amos swoops down and with one hand pulls Carlos by the hair over across his knee with his throat up and other hand in a hammer lock. Amos brings his face down to Carlos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carlos whose neck is stretched back like a goose about to be slaughtered can barely croak out an answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amos loosens his grasp and straightens up. Carlos winces in pain from broken ribs. As he speaks it is now unaccented English, just the slightest trace of Spanish background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is not pushy, just firm and decisive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carlos, who from now on out will be referred to by his real name, RAMIREZ, has had it with the reasoned approach. He now adopts the demeanor of a U.S. Naval Officer reaming an enlisted man a brand new bunghole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amos is doing his best to look unflappable.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (accented English) How do you feel?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because sometimes countries need soldiers and sailors to be on guard so there won't be a war... So all the little children like you and baby Yolanda will be safe.

dialogue.raw_text: Why can't somebody else's Daddy go on the sub and you could stay here and go to my games?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because I'm the one they asked and I'm the one who knows how to do the job.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . AERIAL SHOT - MONTREAL, CANADA - DAY Montreal is an island in the middle of the St. Lawrence. It is a city part way up a mountain, Mount Royale. We TRACK a car as it drives up out of the city, up the mountain to of all places, a cemetery which sits at the foot of a deserted prison that looms above it. The cemetery like the prison is deserted. There can be no more desolate place than a graveyard full of long-dead prisoners whose prison has long since been shut down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : TEMPORARY CIA SAFE HOUSE - MONTREAL, CANADA EXT. ROAD LEADING TO CEMETERY - DAY We SEE Jack's car with him and Ramirez in it driving into the cemetery. As it does, it crosses in front of a video camera inconspicuously placed in a tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A camera mounted atop a light fixture pans with Jack's car all the way up to the prison entrance. Signs on the prison proclaim that it is closed and that trespassing is forbidden. As Jack pulls up at the prison, a plainclothed operative comes out and as Ramirez and Jack pull Ramirez's bag out of the car, the operative slips into the driver's side and whisks it away. The ground around the area is full of snow that has not been plowed so the look of desertion is complete.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is an observation tower in the middle of the room which has become home to the pigeons who now flap noisily out of it as Jack crosses with Ramirez. The place has the look of an impromptu military encampment in a bombed out wreck of a building. In the observation room are several nondescript types. Jack shows Ramirez in.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is an ad hoc operation set up specifically for your mission. When that's over, not even a trace of it will remain. You don't need to know anyone's name. And from now on, your name is Miguel... Security.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So your name really isn't Jack Shaw?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) Of course it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jack walks Ramirez down the corridor. They pass the Surveillance Room, the small cell with its satellite dish and single computer terminal and operator established earlier as Technician #1. From here, cables snake their way along everywhere. The place has the look of a mobile high-tech spy station that just happens to be set up in a former prison. Ramirez looks around. The idea of being in a prison is obviously uncomfortable for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez turns and looks at him in surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks Ramirez straight in the eyes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Your mother is Irish... Irish American.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Something wrong, Miguel?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...No... not really.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your father was in a Cuban prison if I'm correct.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your mother used to take you to visit him there, didn't she?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sure that's a disturbing memory.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't set this up in a prison because it was the first piece of real estate you were shown, did you, sir?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's just say everything has its purpose. And Miguel... no one is to know anything about you other than that you're our student. So don't call me sir, because it's like wearing a sign on your forehead that you're military. From here on out forget the Navy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes sir... Gotcha...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jack and Ramirez walk along until they come to a site which could as easily be in a space station on the dark side of the moon. There in the middle of a huge room looms a plastic enshrouded satellite tracking system. The plastic hangs down from the roof encapsulating this area to protect all of the state of the art computer equipment from the dust. Inside this plastic shrouded space we SEE technicians at monitors which display every approach to the prison as well as monitors which display the surveillance images transmitted back via satellite.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is our surveillance and satellite tracking center. Just as we are plotting to destroy Carlos, if he knew what we're trying to do, I assure you he'd try to find a way to kill us first.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jack pushes through the plastic shroud into a command center- like room. He and Ramirez enter. This place is high-tech, computers and neon lighting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They cross over to the satellite tracking monitors which display both the Libyan and East German safe houses. Sitting in front of one of the monitors is Amos, typing controls into the satellite tracking system.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amos now turns and comes around to Ramirez.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amos is quiet, lets that sink in.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Carlos has two main safe houses. One in Libya, one in East Germany. We have satellites that pass over each one three times a day. Unfortunately, the Russians know exactly when our satellites are in position so we have to assume that Carlos knows as well.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's one person I want you to meet, though I think the two of you have already been introduced.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello Miguel... My name is Amos.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh yeah... I didn't recognize you without my foot chained to the floor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hope there are no hard feelings.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There are a lot of hard feelings. And I'm still gonna sue you when this is over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Miguel, this is a combined Israeli- American operation. Amos here knows Carlos better than anyone in the free world. He was the one who took that picture of Carlos in Libya.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you could get a picture of him why didn't you just kill him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't let all this equipment fool you. Carlos still has the home court advantage. He has the best protection in the world... three layers at least at all times. Next and maybe most important... Carlos himself. The French DST came to arrest him once. He was at his apartment, drunk, playing his guitar. He actually had them convinced it was all a mistake. Then he went into his bathroom, took a shave mind you so he would look his best for the interrogation and when he came out managed to shoot each of them through the forehead. Then he got the informer who had betrayed him, put him down on his knees and killed him... Think of it. He took a shave and didn't even nick himself once.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Finally, there are political realities. Whoever hits Carlos has to realize that he'll unleash against himself a fanatical wave of terrorist activity in retribution.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That by the way, is the last question you're going to ask. From now on you'll get information when and how we want you to get it. Not before. You don't ask questions, you just do what you're told.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Amos, Jack and Ramirez walk amongst the tombstones. Jack and Amos have warm coats. Ramirez does not. He shivers in the cold, but tries not to show his discomfort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack walks right up to Ramirez and mimes a gun with his thumb and index finger and puts it right up to Ramirez's temple and goes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts the imaginary gun to Ramirez's temple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez says nothing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is going to be unlike any learning experience you've ever had before. For one thing, we're going to push to all your limits. Fatigue, frustration and fear. We're going to make you more terrified than you've ever been in your life just to see how you handle the fear. Any other learning experience you get things ninety- nine point nine nine nine percent right you get an "A." Here if you get things ninety-nine point nine nine nine percent right... you get...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dead! And I'll tell you the truth. I honestly in my heart of hearts don't care whether you live or die. Don't take that personal. I don't care whether I live or die. I do care about getting Carlos. That's all I care about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But nothing personal, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not as cold-blooded as my American friend... it would bother me very much if you were dead... so we will teach you to stay alive... but no questions... just do. Otherwise...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When do we start?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You already have. What were the names on the last three tombstones you passed on your right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... I don't know, I wasn't looking. I wasn't paying attention.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what will get you killed. Carlos is always looking... always paying attention. Always.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because Carlos is the master of the techniques of survival which we will teach you and because he is an efficient killer for whoever employs him, then for him there are simply no rules. Unlike you Miguel, you're a rule follower, aren't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Carlos is the opposite of that and that's what's so seductive, you know? He can kill whomever he chooses... ravish whoever he chooses... take whatever he chooses. Do... whatever he chooses. It is to be in many ways a superman, not bound by the mores or morals of humanity.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And if you learn what we can teach you, you'll be one, too. If not, you'll be dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is a huge, empty room. Ramirez sits at the lone table as Amos enters. Ramirez is eating a bowl of porridge. His breath steams out in the cold. The room is freezing but instead of a warm jacket, he wears light prison overalls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He finishes what's left in the bowl. Amos reaches over to a side warming table. There is a huge pot of porridge there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From now on, unless otherwise indicated Ramirez is in the too-tight shirt and tie and light jacket. Jack is in the distance, observing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Good morning. How's the porridge, you like it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: 'Morning. It's not bad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good... finish everything in the pot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's got to be like... eight helpings in there maybe...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No questions... Just do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ramirez is doing furious situps, hanging off the balcony of one of the tiers, with his feet linked under one of the bars so that as he does his sit-up it is over an abyss. Amos stands in front of Ramirez, puffing on a cigar as he speaks, so that Ramirez is gulping in breaths of cigar smoke as he exercises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a silence between them. This is obviously the end of that subject. Then Amos goes on.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Name and place of birth!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Illich Ramirez. Caracas, Venezuela.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your father?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Doctor Jose Altagracia Ramirez... Do you have to smoke that cigar?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Carlos' father abandoned him and his mother because he wanted to be a playboy. Your father abandoned you in effect, when he was sent to prison. Either way, it's a lonely child missing his father. I want you to take what you know of your real father and superimpose it onto this the image of Carlos' father, so when you talk of one you are talking of the other with the same emotion... the same love, the same resentment... the same sadness, the same anger.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As Jack and Ramirez walk toward the cemetery, we SEE Ramirez who wears a lightweight white parka so that he shivers in the cold in contrast to Jack's heavy winter gear. Ramirez carries what appears to be a gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They walk into a scene that is completely surreal. Standing behind every tombstone is one of the crew of trainers. Each man wears a white parka and white pants against the freezing cold. In the center of their impromptu circle stands Ramirez, also wearing white, but of much lighter material so that he shivers in the cold. All of them including Ramirez hold paint pellet guns. It is a cemetery full of living targets which can shoot back. Jack stands outside the circle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez hesitates a moment, trying to remember where the tombstone with the name "Brisson" is. The trainer who stands behind the "Brisson" tombstone has no such hesitation. He fires at Ramirez and an ugly black splotch of paint explodes on Ramirez's white suit. Ramirez shakes his head in frustration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez whirls, misses one, is hit again with another black splotch but hits the Paquet tombstone square in the chest with a black splotch of his own.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You need to not only remember the names on every tombstone, but where they are so when I call out a name, you whirl and shoot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's kind of cold. You think I might be able to borrow a warmer jacket from someone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Brisson! We don't want you to be comfortable. That's just what will get you killed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: DuPres! Paquet!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In the middle of a huge room, a movie set has been erected. There are flats supported by sand bags which form the "set" of a kitchen. The set is perfect in every way but its position inside of a huge prison hall lends a quality of the macabre, since no movie is being shot here and no audience will ever see these performances. Jack is there with Ramirez. He opens the refrigerator and Ramirez looks inside as Jack times him on his watch, then closes the refrigerator. Ramirez sneezes. He has caught a cold but must ignore it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack opens the cupboard.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Top shelf... some milk, some juice, maybe some cottage cheese, a couple bottles of beer, some tomatoes... I don't know...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What kind of milk, how many cartons, open or closed, what kind of juice, how full was the bottle, was it cottage cheese or cream cheese, how many bottles of beer, how many tomatoes? This is life and death!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look here... Ten seconds, how many cups, saucers, plates, look this time!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ramirez sits practicing his Venezuelan accent in English, repeating phrases he hears from a native speaker on a tape recorder as he eats another of the interminable bowls of porridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez once again stands in the center in his lightweight white parka surrounded by trainers in heavy white parkas. Jack is nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez whirls and misses and is hit by the trainer. Jack shakes his head and continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez whirls and hits the trainer in his shoulder at the same time that he himself is hit. Jack's look betrays no emotion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he says this last, Ramirez whirls and shoots another trainer, dead in the chest. Ramirez smiles. He is beginning to enjoy playing terrorist.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Here's the thing about Carlos. He doesn't fit any mold. His father is an extraordinarily wealthy playboy who's a Marxist at the same time... DuFraisne!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The guy's such a fanatic he names his three sons after Lenin. And I don't mean John. The same thing is true for Carlos. He's a guerilla fighter who loves champagne and caviar... LaPierre!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He doesn't want to be Che Guevara, he wants to be the James Bond of the People's Liberation Front. It's not so much radical chic as an excuse for sadism. Paquet!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We are speeding down the road in a suped-up open Jeep POV Ramirez, who is driving. Suddenly, we SEE Jack and Amos up ahead. Amos pulls a lever and a barrier snaps up at chest level across the road. We jam on the brakes and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez is at the wheel. Suddenly he sees the barrier plate a hundred yards in front. He hits the brakes and the emergency brake at the same time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The tires scream and leave black tracks, as the Jeep slides sideways towards the barrier. Just before reaching it, the car completes a 180-degree turn and roars back, but at the last second fishtails and swerves off the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON - RAMIREZ He is obviously frustrated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON - JACK He shakes his head in disgust.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Dead again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ramirez and Jack walk together on the belvedere which is an observation area with a railing around it, overlooking the abandoned prison. In between the belvedere and the prison is a field which is almost completely barren except for one tree. It sits down below. In the distance, we SEE a snow mobile approach with its lights on. Just then, Jack takes a pocket sized remote transmitter and slips it into the front pocket of Ramirez's jacket, turning it on as he does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack quickly moves away from Ramirez. As Ramirez moves, he notices that the snow mobile changes direction as well, and continues to home in on him. And then there is a second snow mobile. And then a third, all of them coming straight for him. He starts to run. The snow mobiles turn and continue bearing down on him, driving him closer toward the railing. We SEE the snow mobiles are controlled by radio antennas, evidently homing in on his transmitter. Jack, who has moved quite a ways off, pulls out a Beretta and sets it on the rail. We SEE on the snow mobiles, a lit- up remote device.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez stands like a deer in the headlights for an instant and then goes running for the gun. He cannot make it to the gun before the first snow mobile barrels down upon him. He is right against the rail now and goes diving into the snow. The snow mobile goes directly over him and crashes through the rail, falling down to the field below. Ramirez is up and running, grabs the gun, fires two rounds and misses, then hits three dummy rounds which click away as the second snow mobile draws closer. Then he fires and hits a headlight, then fires and misses, then fires and hits the remote device. That snow mobile stops in its tracks. The third now barrels down on Ramirez. He clicks off two dummy rounds and just before the snow mobile hits him, a shot rings out. The receiver shatters and we SEE Jack standing with the smoking gun with which he has just saved Ramirez's life.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's a transmitter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Target practice. You're the target.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you shoot out the receivers, they'll stop. There are ten rounds in this clip. The first two are live, the next three dummy, then three live, two dummy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Three times dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is after lunch and Jack and Amos are eating ice cream sundaes while Ramirez sits eating the last bit of porridge from the huge bowl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He motions for the waiter who crosses with a fresh pot and starts to ladle it out into Ramirez's bowl. Ramirez reaches up and tears at his tie and rips open the top button. Ramirez explodes batting the waiter's hand away and sending the bowl flying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With that he rips off the tie and rips open the shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez looks at him in disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez just looks at them, in a kind of shock.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You finish all your porridge?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (deadly) Yeah... yeah... I finished all my porridge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good now you can have some more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Enough of this porridge shit man, hi jo deputa! Fuck it man... I ain't eatin' no more of this shit! And I ain't wearin' this fuckin' shirt anymore either!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why Miguel amigo, whatever is the matter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll tell you what the matter is man... I been here twelve mother fuckin' weeks an' all I've had to eat the whole time is this shit! And those dumb ass basketball games... what's that?! You damn near kill me with those fucking snowmobiles... I haven't seen my family in three months and I still don't know what any plan is or what I'm supposed to be doing!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Congratulations! You're acting like a child... like a spoiled brat...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And not a Navy Lieutenant Commander, which is exactly what would get you killed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Finally you're acting like a willful spoiled child which is just what Carlos was.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We couldn't just let you study Carlos. If this thing is going to work, you have to become him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The two most elite intelligence services in the world and the best you can come up with is this porridge bullshit?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As a child Carlos was fed that porridge that you love so much every day. He hated it. Every woman or man he's ever been close to he told about that porridge... how the very smell of it made him sick. And now it makes you sick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When he was in school he was a scrawny little kid. The last one to get picked for any teams. He felt as clumsy as we've made you feel...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: His father smoked cigars... the same ones whose smell you complained about. The only cover that can save your life... is the one you believe yourself. Now... are you ready to pass the next test?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll take that for a yes. You're about to go into your house. Your wife has told you she was away with the children for a week. She is entering the house for the first time in a week with you. The children are still at Grandma's so the two of you have a nice romantic time ahead of you. Walk through the house... through the living room and the kitchen only. You have thirty seconds. Walk casually through the house so as not to make her suspicious of anything you do and find out if she's telling you the truth or not. If you pass this test your questions will be answered. If not... you'll be sent home to Virginia and this will be the end of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ramirez walks casually through the living room with camera following. Amos and Jack walk behind him. Ramirez bends down to tie his shoe near the sofa. He crosses into the kitchen and camera follows. He opens the refrigerator and takes out a carton of milk. He takes a drink from the carton and dribbles some onto his shirt and onto the floor. He gets an "I'm such a slob" look on his face. Then he replaces the milk, crosses to the sink, takes the sponge off the sink and a paper towel. He mops up the spill with the sponge first and then with the paper towel, then tosses the paper towel into the trash. As he speaks, Ramirez himself will be amazed at how much he is able to deduce using the techniques he's been taught.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks down at Jack's shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gets a quizzical look, crosses to the couch, sniffs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He crosses to Jack and sniffs Jack as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He holds index finger and thumb up to Jack's head like a gun, reprising his mentor's gesture to him and making the sound of a gunshot with his mouth.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (looking at watch) Time's up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nu? Is she telling the truth or lying?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's got to be lying, otherwise this would be a very short test and I don't think that's what you had in mind. She had a man over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She hasn't been here in a week? Then why was the sponge still damp. It means she washed dishes. Take a look at the dish rack. There's water in the tray underneath it. Probably from a couple of plates. There's a bit of water in the silverware tray. The milk is still fresh... not even a hint of being sour and the date on it is a week from today... means she just bought it yesterday or the day before. The margarine's fresh-bought but it's already been opened. Same with the bread.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you know it was a man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (ignoring him a beat) She might have met him at a bar because there's a book of matches in the garbage. She was probably careful to throw the cigarette away but there's still a bit of ash and that cigarette smell at the bottom of the liner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What else?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think they made love on the sofa because one of the cushions has been turned over and there's the indentation of a tennis shoe print in the rug over there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorta like the ones you're wearing, Jack. Besides, I know it was a man because I smelled after-shave on the couch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Cheap kind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jack... you've been fucking my wife.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now who's dead?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We have four quick cuts. Bam! Bam! Bam! Bam! In each one, Ramirez who stands in the center of the trainers, whirls like a ballet dancer and beats each trainer to the punch, hitting dead center on each one with his paint pellet gun. From the side, Amos and Jack nod to each other approvingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A triumphant Ramirez walks with Amos and Jack.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The plan is to get the KGB to eliminate Carlos for us. Carlos knows every link between the KGB and every terrorist organization in the world. He's not only the smoking gun, he knows every contact there ever was. We make the KGB think that Carlos is ready to turn... ready to go over to the CIA, and they'll take him out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why would they think Carlos would go over to the CIA?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Money... fifty million... not for the forces of world revolution this time, but for him, in his pocket with a new identity and CIA protection. They'll believe it... if we lay it out right... they'll believe it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When do we move?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not so fast. You're far from ready. I would think another three months of training and then...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bullshit! I'm ready now. Give me any test you want. Christ, I already passed your tests... what more do you want?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The sun is just setting. There is the silhouette of the prison in the snow. A kind of dark serenity permeates the scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez sits at the table in the huge, dark and empty room. The table is set with champagne and caviar. He has his Arabic book and tape and earphones.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (studying to himself in Arabic) Shoo Ismak? Isme... Carlos. Isme Carlos.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We are in a new setting. It is a kind of dungeon, perhaps once a solitary confinement cell. It is crowded here now with Jack, Amos, and Technician #1 who sit in front of a new bank of monitors. On one we SEE Ramirez eating in the cafeteria.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It should be hitting him now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We PUSH IN on Ramirez on the monitor.

dialogue.raw_text: Hey pal, lighten up, what do you say? It's just a game?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did you say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said lighten up. It's just a game and he's just a kid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's my kid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Great. So why don't we let our kids have a good time. Come on, I'll buy you a beer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't need you to buy me a fuckin' beer, you piece of shit. And you stick your face in my business again and I'll beat the living fuck out of you. What do you say to that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ON - RAMIREZ There isn't a trace of Ramirez here at all. It is pure Carlos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But before Ramirez can move, we HEAR:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez turns. Maura is there beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maura tugs at Ramirez's arm and Frank smirks. Ramirez cages the monster inside and turns with Maura. As he turns, Frank turns to Tyler as if he cannot believe the boy is still there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boy hesitates. Frank rears back his arm to hit him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But before Frank can complete the sentence and strike his child, Ramirez comes flying through the air with a kick planted straight to Frank's head. It is sudden and violent and brutal. He comes down and with one side-kick, "knee-caps" Frank, which is to say he hits the top of Frank's kneecap and breaks it so that it is down around his shin. Frank starts to drop but before he can, Ramirez grabs his ears and brings his head down into his own swiftly rising knee. The result is devastating and Frank's nose is now all across his face. Blood is everywhere and Ramirez does it again. Now the object is Frank's teeth, so that when his head comes off of Ramirez's knee, his mouth is a mass of blood as well. In slow motion, Ramirez turns and sees his son who stares in horror at what his father has just done. At the same time, maura is up and grabbing onto Ramirez. Ramirez however is not done. Frank is completely defenseless now and Ramirez leans him back across his knee, pulls him by the hair exposing his throat like that of a sacrificial lamb about to be slaughtered. This time instead of a knife, it will be a karate chop from Ramirez which will crush Frank's windpipe and kill him. But before he can deliver the blow, Maura grabs his arm. He turns to her, almost about to hit her or throw her off and the two of them are face to face as Ramirez looks from her to his son and realizes how deep into the abyss he has plunged.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are you smilin' at, asshole?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (very quiet) A dead man...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Annibal... please!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Annibal please. Let's go sit down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good idea, Annabelle. Your ol' lady just saved your ass.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Annibal... please... Please...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doin' standing here?! You're supposed to be over there with your team! Now move!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: An ambulance is receiving what is left of Frank on a gurney as Ramirez is led away in handcuffs to a squad car.

direction.raw_text: The cell's metal door SCRAPES as it opens. The POLICE CAPTAIN motions to Ramirez to follow him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leading Ramirez through a number of corridors, the Captain stops at a closed door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remaining outside he motions Ramirez to enter.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (opening the door) He's all yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ramirez enters and sees Jack who smiles his cynical smile.

dialogue.raw_text: Little League, huh? Tough game.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's show time.
