direction.raw_text: DAY - RAIN Ramirez exits with Jack and starts across the street in the rain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez stops dead right in the middle of the street. The traffic swirls around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a long pause. Jack turns cold as ice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez grabs him and throws him against a parked car. He begins choking Jack. He may well kill him. Though Ramirez doesn't see it at first, Jack's gun is already out. Jack nudges Ramirez in the stomach with it. Jack is choking, unable to speak, but the gun is speaking for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez looks down and see the gun and loosens his grip.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I got to have time to think it over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There isn't any time. He's on his way to East Berlin. We have word he's planning another attack in Europe. He'll be there maybe four days at the most.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, I don't know what to do anymore, okay? I almost killed some little kid's father today. I don't know about anything anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, he was a baseball dad. He deserved it. Besides, from what I heard his kid was out, so what's the beef?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know if I could come back from it again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What happened to I want the son of a bitch dead? You think Carlos has had a change of heart and turned nice all of a sudden?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't tell me about Carlos, Jack. I know exactly who Carlos is. I know a hell of a lot better than you do. But, maybe there's more important things to me, like keepin' from goin' crazy... like gettin' back to bein' me instead of me bein' some kind of fuckin' maniac.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You want to get back to bein' you? Then finish it. Kill him. Kill him and he's dead and it's over with. You walk away from it now and what do you think you're gonna be like the next time you read that that son of a bitch blew up some airplane full of women and kids.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, the guy deserves to be dead. I know that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This isn't abstract, Annibal. You're walkin' around with his face. Sooner or later one of the bad guys is gonna see it like Koj did, and next time Amos won't be there to take the bullet for you. Carlos doesn't forget. You help me get him or you're never gonna know when he's comin' after you... Listen to me kid. I don't have any friends, no family, no nothin'. The only relationships I ever had that mattered to me were with the people I killed. But I... I fucking created you! You can't just walk away now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You did create me, didn't you... From the beginning... that kid in the hospital in Bethesda... when I was supposed to be the doctor... It was all bullshit, wasn't it? All an act...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This doesn't have anything to do with you and me. It's you and Carlos. You help me kill him... or I swear to you... I'll make sure he knows about you... I'll use you for bait. You and your whole fuckin' family too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Huh? Huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You want to try and kill me, that doesn't solve your problem, pally. You've got a Carlos problem. That's the guy you've got to kill. That's what it's all about now... you... and your family... or him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . RAMIREZ HOME - KITCHEN - VIRGINIA - NIGHT Ramirez is there alone with Maura. They are in mid-argument.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, Ramirez bellows and slams his hand down on the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maura is shocked by the sudden violence in him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at her almost in disgust. She sees the look and slaps him. Faster than she could ever have considered, he slaps her and sends her back into the wall. She holds her cheek. He is an inch away from her face and now he is about to show her Carlos, to become him in front of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He speaks very quietly, pulling the curtain aside, taking off the mask and letting her see the full horror.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No! I won't let you do it! You're not going back to those subs! It's changed you... You need help, Annibal. You could get some kind of stress disability or...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Enough!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, not enough. Whatever is going on out there with your job...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: With my job!? What do you think my job is, Maura... huh? What do you think is out there? A nice, pretty safe little world with shopping malls and little league and ballet lessons. You sit here in your little kitchen and cook your little meals...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: People are killing people out there! Jackals are licking up their blood waiting for the next corpse to drop... and I'm one of them. You get that? Do you get that now?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've murdered people. Not safe and clean and surgical firing a missile from some ship, but close and with my hands so their blood splattered on me... so their brains splattered on me. And they weren't the enemy, Maura... they were Allies. They were on our side. It was just to keep a cover... I've betrayed everything I ever believed in. I've betrayed you... I've fucked other women... I've killed men... There was a woman I would have killed but I just ran out of time. I've let friends die... I've become a terrorist... and I've made you and the children a target. Do you understand what I'm saying to you? Do you see me now? Do you see the monster? There's another one worse than me and he is out there and he will kill you and the children if I don't kill him first... . That's my job, Maura. And if you don't mind, I'm late for work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY - ESTABLISHING SHOT SUPER: WEST BERLIN - JULY, 1987 EXT. BERLIN WALL - LOOKING INTO EAST BERLIN - DAY We are ON the ramparts on the top of the Berlin Wall. These are platforms from which people can stand and look into East Berlin, they're covered with graffiti to the East Germans, LET MY PEOPLE GO, that sort of thing. They look down over they dingy wall that divides the city marked with machine gun nests and observation posts. Jack stands there with Ramirez.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez locates the beer hall through his binoculars.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We used a double agent to get word to the Russians that Carlos is really here to close his deal with us and not to plan a new attack in Europe. He has a new girlfriend... He's been fucking her brains out since he got here. He has her brought over every night in a limo. You'll be dropped near the mansion... as soon as she goes in, you make as if you're sneaking out... the Russians will be watching. You'll go to the meet. It's at that beer hall, there... see? You see it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Got it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You go to the meet at the beer hall. Play it out... let 'em take your picture... then you've got to get back. They're going to have to analyze the pictures and see through your disguise before they can authorize a hit. They won't be able to do that before you're able to get back to the mansion. At twenty-one fifteen a Volga with diplomatic plates, DC- four-five-nine-two will come by the northeast corner of the compound. It will slow down... you jump in. If you can't make it for any reason, there will be another run at exactly twenty-one forty-five. It's your only ticket out so don't be late.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who do I meet? Who's my contact?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me... My ass is on the line too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who cares? This isn't you and me. It's me and him. If the Russians don't go for the bait for any reason...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If the Russians don't go for the bait for any reason you will have gotten out of there at twenty-one fifteen per orders.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If the Russians don't go for the bait for any reason, I'll go in there and kill him myself. And if I'm still alive I might just come looking for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : WEISSEN, EAST BERLIN THROUGH BINOCULARS Across a street with a tree-lined divider, a large mansion surrounded by a ten-foot high brick wall. The mansion's front windows are heavily shuttered, with little light filtering through. Nearby is a small lake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ivan looks through binoculars, staking out the mansion. He suddenly becomes agitated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andrei picks up his camera.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: [Look!]
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A man's figure emerges stealthily from the shadows of the mansion's back wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The blonde, bearded Ramirez.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: [You think it's him?]
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ... The quick sound of the camera shutters. Faintly we HEAR the sound of a motorbike start up. Then we SEE Ramirez on the motorbike heading off. Ivan and Andrei follow him at a distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The KGB car falls in behind another car separating it from the motorbike and follows Ramirez into town. He passes by giant steam pipes in the foreground as the KGB car follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A tram wipes the screen to reveal Ramirez, on his motorbike, followed by the KGB car. The landscape is desolate, with drab row-houses. Ramirez gets to a red light. As it turns green he sees the KGB car in his mirror. He jams across the street, just barely fitting in between two criss-crossing streetcars. Ivan and Andre lose sight of Ramirez.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ivan and Andre shoot forward and then slow, as they spot Ramirez buying a newspaper at a newstand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON - RAMIREZ He holds his motorcycle helmet in his hand, and using it as a mirror, he sees the KGB car in its reflection. Satisfied that they have caught up with him again, he walks across the street to the beer hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The large bierstube is crowded, noisy and enveloped in a thick cloud of cigarette smoke. Its lively, at times rowdy clientele is in various stages of intoxication. As the loud, oom-pah-pah-pah band plays popular German music, those who are not too busy eating, talking, or emptying liter-sized beer steins, sing along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fighting the crowd, he heads for the back of the beer hall, looking for his contact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Entering the place, they pretend to be camera-carrying Russian tourists. A common sight in East Berlin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stops and stares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the jam pack, the profile of a man, with a Tyrol hat who sits along the back wall. Busy eating, he seems totally oblivious to the hoopla around him. We can't really see his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he cautiously approaches what he thinks is Jack. It isn't him. There is a sudden look of panic on his face and then he spots Jack also in the same kind of hat. Lifting his head, and turning to face Ramirez, we too recognize him. Under the hat, and the new heavy eyebrows and mustache, is... Jack. He smiles, takes off his hat, and motions his quest to sit down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's posing with a giant stein. A slight shift of focus and we can see Ramirez. Jack, however, is hidden by the waiter's back. Then, the Waiter moves on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A clear, unobstructed picture of Jack and Ramirez up close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... The rapid CLICKING stops only when the view of the two is blocked again by other people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez emerges from the beer hall. He heads back to his motorbike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seconds later, the two KGB come out. This time, only Andrei takes after Ramirez. Ivan gets into a taxi which heads in an opposite direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reaching the mansion, Ramirez discreetly steals his way toward its back wall. Then, just as slyly as he earlier had materialized, he disappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watching Ramirez vanish into the mansion wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RAMIREZ'S HIDING PLACE - NEAR MANSION - NIGHT He lies in the thick bushes, completely obscured from anyone's view and now he removes the blond wig and the rest of his disguise. Underneath his "disguise" clothes, he is wearing a pair of black jeans and black T-shirt. He looks exactly like Carlos now.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: IT IS IMPORTANT TO UNDERSTAND WHAT IS GOING ON HERE
THE REAL CARLOS HAS NOT DYED HIS HAIR BLOND
THIS WAS NOT THE REASON FOR RAMIREZ PUTTING ON A BLOND WIG
THE LOGIC HERE IS THAT IF THE "REAL CARLOS" WERE IN FACT GOING TO A MEET WITH A CIA AGENT, HE WOULD HAVE PUT ON SUCH A DISGUISE TO MAKE SURE HE WAS NOT SPOTTED BY THE RUSSIANS

direction.raw_text: : IT IS IMPORTANT TO UNDERSTAND WHAT IS GOING ON HERE. THE REAL CARLOS HAS NOT DYED HIS HAIR BLOND. THIS WAS NOT THE REASON FOR RAMIREZ PUTTING ON A BLOND WIG. THE LOGIC HERE IS THAT IF THE "REAL CARLOS" WERE IN FACT GOING TO A MEET WITH A CIA AGENT, HE WOULD HAVE PUT ON SUCH A DISGUISE TO MAKE SURE HE WAS NOT SPOTTED BY THE RUSSIANS.

direction.raw_text: Jack takes off his disguise as he drives the Volga to the appointed corner of Carlos' compound. He looks at his watch. reads: 9:15 as he slows the car to a crawl.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to himself) Come on... come on...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . RAMIREZ'S HIDING PLACE - NEAR MANSION - NIGHT Ramirez watches as Jack cruises by.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Not till he's dead, Jack. Not till he's dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jack sees that Ramirez is not going to show.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A head shot of Ramirez in his latest blond, bearded disguise. Grainy and blurred at first, it's gradually being brought into sharp focus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to reveal a GROUP OF MEN closely watching the screen of an impressive, state-of-the-art computer. We recognize only one of them. Andrei. At the computer's sophisticated keyboard -- manipulating the images on the screen -- are TWO TECHNICIANS in white overalls. Right behind them stands the Head KGB Officer from Moscow and his Aide.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (orders the technicians) [Now Carlos.]
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It bisects, to allow a picture of the real Jackal (the splitting image of Ramirez) to appear on the right half of the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Head KGB Officer puts on his glasses and takes a closer look at the monitor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the two technicians toys with the keyboard.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: [The beard and moustache.]
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The beard and moustache on Ramirez' disguised image slowly disappear. The two faces look very similar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A huge nose covers the entire left half of the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The upper part of the nose only. And... the incriminating hairline where the bogus schnoz had been superimposed on the real one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the aquiline nose assumes the shape of the Jackal's -- the hair changes both color and form to match his -- the two faces on the screen become identical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Head KGB Officer turns to his Aide.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) [The nose is a fake.]
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: [Match the nose. And get rid of this wig...]
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: [Have you identified the one he was meeting with?]
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: [His name is Jack Shaw. CIA Counterterrorism.]
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: [Get me the MFS on the secure phone. I want them out of the way.]
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It opens slowly. One by one, a half dozen MFS -- including the two we've seen earlier -- sneak out. Just as furtively, armed KGB -- led by the Head KGB Officer and his Aide move in through the still-open door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RAMIREZ'S HIDING PLACE - NEAR MANSION - NIGHT He watches the KGB men enter the compound.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (sotto voce) Don't blow it Comrades... kill him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Meeting no resistance on the ground floor -- whose security apparently has been the task of the MFS -- the intruders climb the open, spiral staircase. They move cautiously, silencer-equipped weapons in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reaching the upper floor, they hear the muffled sound of RHYTHMIC MUSIC coming from the far end of the hallway to their right. The Head KGB Officer motions his Aide to move into the corridor to their left. He does, taking three KGB with him. Four others -- including Andrei and Ivan -- follow the Head KGB Officer into the hallway to their right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's long, with several rooms on each side. As Vladimir moves gingerly into the first one, Ivan covers him from the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Illuminated only by the light which filters through the open door, the room is quite dark. A faint sound of SNORING reaches Andrei from the bed closest to the door. Quickly there, his arm goes up. Then, for a split second, the flash of metal as the knife comes down hard. The victim's last MURMUR. Followed by the SOUND OF MOVEMENT at the other bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the beam of Ivan's flashlight, a waking JAPANESE is reaching for his gun. Pffft. Pfffft. And he too falls back to sleep. Eternally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: more JAPANESE in the midst of a Go game meet the same fate. A burst from Head KGB Officer's automatic finishes them off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doing away with several more of Carlos' multinational gang, the five KGB finally reach the room with the large, heavy French doors at the end of hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quietly approaching the carved-wood doors, a KGB tries the knobs. The doors are locked. Suddenly, the pulsating LATIN BEAT which emanated continuously from behind the doors, stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's startled by the sudden silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not wasting any time, Andrei and Ivan kick the doors open. Diving to the side, they cover the other two KGB who storm in with their Kalashnikovs very much at the ready.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (whispering) [Quick! Quick!]
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The voluptuous blonde -- her body glazed with post-coitus sweat -- is paralyzed with fear; covering her prized assets seems the last thing on her mind. She gapes at the KGB marauders with wide, blue eyes. Not so, Ramirez's look-alike. Caught reaching from under the sheets to replace the tape in the stereo by the bed, he instinctively tries for his gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Standing at the door. His automatic no longer has a silencer.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (sarcastic) Don't even think about it. It would deprive the KGB of the pleasure of interrogating you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Surprisingly, he seems quite relieved.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ? I thought...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: What? That we were your new friends... The CIA... Jack Shaw...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Head KGB Officer motions to Andrei, who throws Carlos his pants -- but not before checking to make sure there's no weapon in them. He then hands the blonde -- who finally hides her bazooms behind a sheet -- her clothes.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: BACK TO SCENE HEAD KGB OFFICER

dialogue.raw_text: Jack Shaw...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop playing games. And it's no use looking behind me... Your associates can no longer be of assistance. Not to you, not to anyone...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (angry) Comrade, you'd getter have an explanation -- HEAD KGB OFFICER You've got it all wrong, Illich. It's you who has all the explaining to do... Now get dressed! (to the blonde) You too, Fraulein.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My pants...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing; getting dressed) That's what was going on in Libya. The CIA... The DST... They're trying to set me up and you're falling for it, you idiot!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Enough. We tailed you to your meeting. We have the pictures of you with Shaw.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's impossible. I've been here all night. (points to the blonde) Ask her. (to the blonde) Tell him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She's putting stockings on a pair of legs that could distract even the most committed KGB.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in a voice matching her looks) It's true. All night...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (unimpressed) We know about your women... Now hurry up, both of you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: With Kalashnikovs still trained on Carlos, they seem unable to resist stealing glances at the blonde.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He seems truly eager to leave with them now, as if confident he can prove his case. Dressed, with the exception of a jacket, he casually grabs one which lies on a nearby chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too late. The Scorpion machine-pistol is already out, spouting deadly accurate fire. He kills the Head KGB Officer first, then...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Head KGB Officer) I'll prove it to you. You'll be pleading for my forgiveness. Let's just go. I want to be interrogated. I demand to be interrogated.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They drop like flies, their bullets hitting everything but him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hysterical, she screams her healthy lungs out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly there's the sound of APPROACHING STEPS. The KGB are down the corridor, rushing to the bedroom, led by the Aide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He doesn't hesitate. Firing a few rounds at them, he sprints toward the window and literally flies through its shattering glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ramirez lies in some bushes about fifty yards from the house, dressed in the black jeans and T-shirt. He hears the gunfire from the mansion.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What the fuck?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It's a dark night, and only a few dim lights illuminate the rather large back yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Landing in a bed of flowers, he rolls, and is quickly on his feet with the machine-pistol in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Securing the courtyard, they rush to the spot where, apparently, they'd seen him land. Carlos, however, is no longer there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glued to the back of a tree, the Jackal cuts them down with one short burst and goes for the KGBs who appear at the broken window. As they take cover, he quickly confiscates a Kalashnikov from the dead KGB closest to him and makes it to the high wall which encircles the place. Carlos climbs over the wall with the Kalashnikov and drops outside the compound to the grass below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sees to his horror that Carlos is getting away. He is ready to scream, going crazy. He has no gun, he wouldn't stand a chance against Carlos, but there is no way he is going to let him get away, no way. He looks around for a rock... anything. There is nothing. Carlos turns his back. Ramirez sees his chance, he gets up on one knee ready to make his move when suddenly he sees two more KGB guys come running around the wall of the compound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He mouths the words:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Kill him... Kill him...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He whirls and fires at the two KGBs who fall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can't believe it. Carlos is getting away?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He suddenly gets a look as if he feels someone's presence. His eyes open wide and he starts to turn when Ramirez comes flying out of the darkness and leaps on Carlos. The two are dressed exactly alike. Carlos is hit from behind and is stunned and drops the assault rifle. Ramirez has Carlos down and is choking him. Carlos looks up at him more shocked than anything else. Finally Carlos manages to break the grasp and kicks Ramirez off. Now it is a dazzling display of martial arts. Then Ramirez charges Carlos and tackles him and the two go rolling off into the bushes and darkness. When they roll out of the bushes we have no idea which one is which or who we should be rooting for. Just then Jack's Volga drives up at the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They roll over onto the bodies of two dead KGB. There is a Kalashnikov on the ground pointed into the Carlos on the bottom's side. The Carlos who is on top manages to get his finger over to the trigger and pulls it sending a burst into the Carlos on the bottom's body. Just then the Carlos on top looks up and sees Jack standing over him with a gun pointed at him ready to shoot. In b.g. we HEAR cars with sirens approaching. The Carlos on top looks over to Jack who is ready to shoot him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack just stares at him and then lowers his gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns around and starts to get into the Volga. The Carlos on top, whom we just thought was Ramirez bends down and reaches for the dead KGB's pistol.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't shoot. It's me you asshole!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's get the fuck out of here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He gets that sixth sense feeling and turns around, his gun raised and pointed at the man whose hand is now on the pistol. Is it Carlos or Ramirez, who is standing there with pistol in hand almost turned to Jack but still at a disadvantage in this Mexican stand off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man with the pistol knows this is a password of some kind and the look on his face betrays the fact that he doesn't have an answer. Jack is just about to shoot him when a burst of machine gun fire is heard from the approaching cars and it rips into the tree next to Jack who dives for cover. That act of self-preservation gives the man we now realize is the real Carlos the chance he needs. With catlike grace he dives, rolls and vanishes into the shadows. He has gotten away and Jack has to decide whether to go after his quarry or rescue his friend. He opts for the latter, scoops up Annibal and throws him into the Volga and speeds off as cars approach from the other side.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Have you come looking for me now, Annibal?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the fuck are you talking about...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Awfully warm for this time of year isn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY - ESTABLISHING INT. PRIVATE ROOM - BETHESDA NAVAL HOSPITAL - DAY Ramirez is in bed, hooked up to all the monitors and tubes and IVs but he is going to make it. Jack is there with him, having just entered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack nods his head. Ramirez almost breaks down in tears. Jack crosses to him to comfort him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Any word?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How you feeling?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did he get away?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then it was all for nothing... the whole thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No it wasn't. He's finished. The KGB bought it. As far as they're concerned, he's the enemy now. He'll bounce around from one country to the next. But his paymasters have disowned him. None of their client states will risk using him. No one'll trust him again. He'll spend the rest of his life looking over his shoulder waiting to be betrayed. And it'll happen... sooner or later... when it's to some country's advantage... they'll give him up or they'll trade him. He's finished. It worked and he's finished.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not for me he isn't... There are still two of us...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A car pulls up at the hospital and Maura gets out and enters the hospital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maura is there with Ramirez. He is in mid-conversation with her. We don't know how long she's been there. He opens his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She crosses to him and gently takes his hand in hers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maura looks at him imploring him with her eyes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Is it over?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have to make a new life for yourself and the children.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maura, anytime I start a car I'll wonder if this is the one that explodes. I couldn't bear the thought of you and the children being in that danger. He'll want me and everyone I've ever loved to be dead. Trust me... I know how he thinks because it's the way I think now too. I am so... sorry. I am so sorry...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I won't leave you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maura, when my father was put into prison he told my mother to take me and leave and start a new life. That's what you've got to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not in prison and I'm not your mother and I won't leave you. I will not let him do this to us. Not him... not the CIA... not anyone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He'll come after me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get me a gun and teach me to shoot and he'll have to deal with both of us. This animal will not destroy my family. Please... come home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . RAMIREZ HOME - VIRGINIA - DAY We hear a phone ring and it is picked up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear the voice of a friend of hers named GRACE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear the phone hang up. We hear the sound of a door opening and closing that leads into the garage from the house. We hear the sound of a car door opening. And then the key turning in an ignition. And then the door is blown off the garage as we see the Ramirez family car burst into an inferno and blaze away inside the garage in a fiery blast which would kill one and all instantly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.; THRU PHONE) Hello...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.; THRU PHONE) Hi... listen, do you and Annibal want to come over with the kids for a barbeque this afternoon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.; THRU PHONE) Uh sure, I think... but could I call you back later? We're just about to go to church. Annibal and the kids are already in the car.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.; THRU PHONE) Okay, call me when you get back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.; THRU PHONE) Great. Talk to you later. Bye bye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The cemetery is set up for a funeral. There are various Navy officers and their families in the chairs. At the back of it all stands Jack wearing sunglasses, his face a mask into which it is impossible to read any emotion of any kind. There are four graves and four coffins, two adult-sized and two small ones. Admiral Crawford addresses the mourners.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How does one even begin to comprehend a tragedy like this. A highly respected Naval officer returns from six months of hazardous duty. He has escaped the danger we all come to know in the service of our country. He is about to go to church with his beloved family and in an instant... they are no more. They are with God. Our minds cannot comprehend such tragedy... only an undying faith in the Almighty a faith that says even though we cannot see it, there is a plan. That and the knowledge that as in life, so for eternity are they together...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He whispers to himself as he takes off his sunglasses.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Now you're free.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . MARTIN - DAY It is a beautiful island community with clusters of villas overlooking a magnificent coastline. A postal truck winds its way towards one of the houses. The POSTMAN gets out of his truck and crosses to the door of the house. He knocks on the door. The door opens... it is Ramirez... or Carlos... we don't know which. He wears shorts and a shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Postman hands the man an envelope. He signs for it and opens the envelope. It is a newspaper clipping...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mister Mendoza?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Special delivery letter for you sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: NAVAL OFFICER AND FAMILY KILLED IN FIERY CRASH

direction.raw_text: The headline is: NAVAL OFFICER AND FAMILY KILLED IN FIERY CRASH. There is a handwritten note attached. It says, "Rest in Peace."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tips the postman and closes the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Not bad news I hope.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Someone... died.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm so sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This guy's better off dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No one is better off dead I think.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Some people are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . MARTIN - DAY Mendoza crosses into the house holding the newspaper clipping. He takes a cigarette lighter and burns it and across his face there is a hint of a smile... a very cold smile. He crosses out to the veranda. Down on the beach below, we SEE Maura and the baby and Joey playing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We now know the man is Ramirez. He walks down the steps of his house to the beach to his wife and his children as we:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Poppi... come down and play with us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: the following: SUDAN 1994 Two bodyguard types wait outside the building at the entrance. An old man who walks with a cane and whose face is horribly disfigured by burns hobbles in to the medical building. He passes a plaque on the wall that says in English and Arabic:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We SUPER THE FOLLOWING:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . WASFI MUHAMMED, M.D.; PhD. Cosmetic and Plastic Surgery
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: HE MOVED TO YEMEN, THEN JORDAN, THEN SYRIA AND FINALLY TO THE SUDAN

direction.raw_text: . HE MOVED TO YEMEN, THEN JORDAN, THEN SYRIA AND FINALLY TO THE SUDAN.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: NO FURTHER ACTS OF TERRORISM WERE EVER ATTRIBUTED TO CARLOS AGAIN

direction.raw_text: The old man locks the door and stands in front of the mirror. He pulls off the burn makeup and scalp wig and we see that he is Carlos. Several years older, but unmistakable. He takes off the old man's clothes and stuffs them in a trash can and underneath he wears the black jeans and T-shirt. Then he straightens up and exits the rest room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .'S OFFICE - MEDICAL BLDG. - DAY Carlos walks down the corridor and enters the medical suite of Doctor Wasfi Muhammed. There is a plaque on the door which says, DR. WASFI MUHAMMED, M.D., PhD, Cosmetic and Plastic Surgery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MUHAMMED'S OFFICE - SURGERY SUITE - DAY This is a surgery suite complete with gas anesthetic, a kind of high-tech barber chair that reclines for full surgery, gleaming scalpels, etc. DR. MOHAMMED is there with Carlos. The Doctor is hastily washing his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns around to look into the barrel of Carlos' drawn and cocked .38 automatic.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . MUHAMMED You're quite early. I wasn't expecting you for another half an hour.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I like to be unannounced. It's safer that way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . MUHAMMED Yes, yes, of course. If you'll just have a seat. I've done everything as you said. My assistant has been let go for the day. I'll administer the anesthetic myself. I assure you sir, you are completely safe here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The scene is as before. The two bodyguards stand watch. Suddenly a car pulls up. Another bodyguard gets out and out of this car steps Carlos. The bodyguards acknowledge him as he enters the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MUHAMMED'S OFFICE - SURGERY SUITE - DAY Carlos leans back in the surgery chair. There is an IV attached to his arm. A Doctor in a surgical mask stands over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pulls down his surgical mask and Carlos looks up at his own face. It is Ramirez. He holds Carlos, who struggles against the anaesthetic. Suddenly, a second pair of hands grab Carlos as well. It is Jack.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Feeling drowsy now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you like to see what your new face is going to look like when we're done?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes... of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's going to look just like this...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: An ambulance is pulled up at the rear entrance and two attendants push a gurney out of the building with a patient whose face is covered by an oxygen mask. The two attendants push the gurney into the ambulance and race off.
direction.name: direction
